segment.source: Export or Import Default Application Associations
segment.target: Export or Import Default Application Associations

segment.source: Export or Import Default Application Associations
segment.target: Export or Import Default Application Associations

segment.source: Export or Import Default Application Associations
segment.target: Export or Import Default Application Associations

segment.source: You can use the Deployment Image Servicing and Management (DISM) tool to change the default programs associated with a file name extension or protocol in a Windows® image.
segment.target: You can use the Deployment Image Servicing and Management (DISM) tool to change the default programs associated with a file name extension or protocol in a Windows® image.

segment.source: Generate Default Application Associations XML File
segment.target: Generate Default Application Associations XML File

segment.source: Deploy your Windows image to a test computer and configure the programs that are included in your image.
segment.target: Deploy your Windows image to a test computer and configure the programs that are included in your image.

segment.source: You can log into Windows and use Control Panel to select your default application associations.
segment.target: You can log into Windows and use Control Panel to select your default application associations.

segment.source: You can export the default application associations that you have configured to an XML file on a network share or removable media so that you can import them into the WIM or VHD file before you deploy it to your destination computers.
segment.target: You can export the default application associations that you have configured to an XML file on a network share or removable media so that you can import them into the WIM or VHD file before you deploy it to your destination computers.

segment.source: Set default application associations
segment.target: Set default application associations

segment.source: Install your Windows image to a test computer.
segment.target: Install your Windows image to a test computer.

segment.source: For more information about how to apply a Windows image, see Apply Images Using DISM.
segment.target: For more information about how to apply a Windows image, see Apply Images Using DISM.

segment.source: Start the test computer and complete Windows Setup.
segment.target: Start the test computer and complete Windows Setup.

segment.source: Click Search, click Settings, and then type Default Programs.
segment.target: Click Search, click Settings, and then type Default Programs.

segment.source: Click Default Programs.
segment.target: Click Default Programs.

segment.source: You can configure default programs by file name extension or by application.
segment.target: You can configure default programs by file name extension or by application.

segment.source: For example, to set an installed photo viewing application as the default program that is used to open all of the file types and protocols that it supports, click Set your default programs, click the photo viewing application in the program list, and then click Set this program as default.
segment.target: For example, to set an installed photo viewing application as the default program that is used to open all of the file types and protocols that it supports, click Set your default programs, click the photo viewing application in the program list, and then click Set this program as default.

segment.source: Export default application association settings
segment.target: Export default application association settings

segment.source: On your test computer, open a command prompt with administrative credentials.
segment.target: On your test computer, open a command prompt with administrative credentials.

segment.source: If you are using a version of Windows other than Windows 8, use the Deployment Tools Command Prompt installed with the ADK or navigate to the DISM directory on your local computer.
segment.target: If you are using a version of Windows other than Windows 8, use the Deployment Tools Command Prompt installed with the ADK or navigate to the DISM directory on your local computer.

segment.source: Export the default application association settings from the test computer to an .xml file on a network share or USB drive.
segment.target: Export the default application association settings from the test computer to an .xml file on a network share or USB drive.

segment.source: For example, at a command prompt type the following command:
segment.target: For example, at a command prompt type the following command:

segment.source: Where:
segment.target: Where:

segment.source: Server is the name of the server or computer that contains the share that you will export the default application association settings.
segment.target: Server is the name of the server or computer that contains the share that you will export the default application association settings.

segment.source: Share is the name of the share where you will export the default application association settings.
segment.target: Share is the name of the share where you will export the default application association settings.

segment.source: Add or Remove Default Application Association Settings to a Windows Image
segment.target: Add or Remove Default Application Association Settings to a Windows Image

segment.source: You can change the default application association settings in a WIM or VHD file before you deploy it to your destination computers.
segment.target: You can change the default application association settings in a WIM or VHD file before you deploy it to your destination computers.

segment.source: You can also add and remove default application association settings from an online image.
segment.target: You can also add and remove default application association settings from an online image.

segment.source: Import default application association settings
segment.target: Import default application association settings

segment.source: On your technician computer, open a command prompt with administrative credentials.
segment.target: On your technician computer, open a command prompt with administrative credentials.

segment.source: If you are using a version of Windows other than Windows 8, use the Deployment Tools Command Prompt installed with the ADK or navigate to the DISM directory on your local computer.
segment.target: If you are using a version of Windows other than Windows 8, use the Deployment Tools Command Prompt installed with the ADK or navigate to the DISM directory on your local computer.
